abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            improving water sanitation in Indonesia. As a growing
            middle-income country, Indonesia needed to substantially
            increase access to sanitation services. Second Water and
            Sanitation for Low Income Communities Project, funded by
            World Bank helped Indonesian communities to create the
            technical capacity to plan, manage and sustain improved
            water programs, sanitation, and community health services.
            It improved hygiene and health behavior, by providing safe
            options for waste disposal and clean water supply. The
            project also provided technical assistance to educate local
            communities about the importance of managing their own water
            and sanitation in a sustainable way.
